summary: What are some things that you want to see for season 2 ?
question: What are some things that you want to see for season 2 ?
answer:
Hello, I love this question. Okay, here goes: 

1) Flashbacks. And I don’t mean these long, boring, bold & the beautiful dramatic flashbacks, but I mean like 1-3 frame glitches, sparks, of the following things: Eve and Villanelle flashbacking to the stabbing, Eve flashbacking to that moment when she attacked Niko at the Bridge Club (because, come on, he should not forgive her for that even though I think he probably will), but most of all: they made Anna be this huge force in Villanelle’s life. Six years later, the therapist still asks Villanelle if she dreams about Anna. Anna has to have been a very big deal, and the way she died so abruptly felt incredibly rushed. I hope we get some insight into why Anna was such an important factor for Villanelle. In the books, she flashbacks to her on and off, so I would want that in the show as well. 

2) I want to know if there is more to Konstantin’s “He was off limits” line about Bill. 

3) I want to see Villanelle pissed off about the knife-thing. Like, insanely, child-in-supermarket-level temper tantrum pissed off. 

4) I want to see what the freaking note Nadia wrote said because I have a feeling that it sure as hell does not say “Konstantin”. I have a feeling that thing is going to say “Martens”. I’m not going to go too deeply into this because most of it is connected to the second book, but boy oh boy, that woman is not clean. 

5) I have this mental image where season 2 doesn’t pick off right where season 1 ended, but a little bit in the future. In this image, Eve is in a hotel room, surrounded by all the stuff she’s gathered together about Villanelle and where she might be. And while she’s going through this stuff, we see Villanelle in a club somewhere, trying to have “fun”, but it’s so obvious that she’s thinking about the stabbing. So the frames skipping on and off between Eve and V would be awesome, but ugh, I know I’m not going to get this. (Phoebe come back I NEED YOU) 

6) Natalie. I want the story behind the name “Natalie.” So far, Villanelle has been Natalie in Bletcham, Natalia Popova in Russia, and when Eve asks who offed Nadia, Konstantin went “a little angry girl called Natalie”. What the fuck is that about? What’s up with the name Natalie?? 

7) I want Villanelle in action. Gore-y, chilling action. The kind of action that makes the viewers remember that she’s a cold-blooded killer. But I don’t want to see Eve in that scene, if you get my drift… 

8) Eve & Villanelle. These two idiots better get some proper screen-time together, and I’ll be fucking damned if Eve doesn’t come up to Villanelle and ask to see the scar. I. Will. Be. Damned. Also, I want these two to get the ending Luke Jennings made for them. That’s all I can come up with, for now :)

Warning: This Is NOT A Spoiler-Free Blog

The tumblr for farfarawaysite.com. We are a fan run site that posts high quality tagless photography from many current and past fantasy, action and adventure, science fiction, horror and historical television shows. Our tumblr will only highlight certain updates. Visit our website daily for a full listing of new content. We hope you do enjoy all your visits.

blog.name: garland-on-thy-brow
blog.title: the brooding drummer who steals fans' hearts
blog.description:
Gene | lesbian | 23 | they/them, she/her, occasionally he/him.

Main topic: Late Roman Republic and its interpretations in fiction. Won't shut up about the portrait of Sempronia. Won't shut up about Bridge Theatre Julius Caesar.

Anthony J. Crowley wrote Shakespeare's Julius Caesar. Veva Blanc is alchemical. Symbrock is Brutecass. Killing Eve is EVErything. Rachel Weisz should play Philippa Eilhart.

[AO3]. Tags, about.

summary: Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre
title: Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre
body:
Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre

BBC America’s new thriller, Killing Eve, is the story of an MI5 investigator and an assassin who are both on a mission to find and kill the other but end up becoming mutually obsessed. Set primarily in present-day London, it is fundamentally a cat-and-mouse spy story but manages to be so much more.

The assassin, who has adopted the nom de gurreVillanelle, is played by the lovely Jodie Comer. She…

View On WordPress

summary:
Killing Eve: I'll Deal with Him Later 
↳ "I believe there is a female assassin operating internationally and she’s targeted a...
caption:
Killing Eve: I’ll Deal with Him Later
↳ “I believe there is a female assassin operating internationally and she’s targeted a number of influential people. She doesn’t have a signature, but she certainly has style, and I don’t know who or what is behind her, but I don’t think she’s slowing down, and that just interested me. I guess.”

summary: Ok so my English is not that great so I hope my question will make sense lol. So I read ur amazing fic the void and let’s just...
question: Ok so my English is not that great so I hope my question will make sense lol. So I read ur amazing fic the void and let’s just say shit got really dark. Villanelle basically slaughtered and entire family. Do you think villanelle can or will get that dark in the actual show? Again I hope I made sense I’ve been practicing:)
answer:
Hello! Your question makes perfect sense, no worries! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time and hammering your way through 31 chapters of pure angst and crying. I raise my hat to you, friend. 

So, about Villanelle and what she could and couldn’t do. “I’m you, Eve, just without the guilt” (book 2). I think that statement says a lot actually. Making the decision to have Villanelle wipe out Perry’s entire family except the one who was still considered a child (which I think is a kind of “limit” Villanelle has if the tv series is anything to go by, she could have shot Irina at point blank, no trouble), it didn’t come easily. But, in The Void, I thought in the terms of: Villanelle had just spent two months in Chechnya because she’d “disobeyed” her handler Ivan (which she hadn’t even really done, but then again, she did not kill Carolyn herself). If she wanted to keep her lifestyle, there was nothing else to do, then to do her job. 

About how violent and how gore-y she could be: in book 1, she hacks Simon’s (Bill’s) head off with a freaking chucabocho. And she revels in it. Her physical satisfaction from killing is clearly stated by Luke Jennings. Now, I don’t feel that the series itself portrays this as much as the book does, because come on, series-Villanelle is funny and relatable and we love her. And one of the reasons why we love her is: we haven’t seen the worst of her yet. I think if they’d actually showed Villanelle killing Nadia in Russia, it would have affected my view of her character. Now though, she’s stabbed and wounded and probably either very pissed off or very impressed. Based on her character and her “childishness”, my money’s on the first option, but I still doubt that the show will ever take Villanelle to the depth of her violence and actually show it to us. Part of me wishes they would, though. I’d love to see her in proper action. I hope this answers your question :)

Her physical satisfaction from killing is clearly stated by Luke Jennings. Now, I don’t feel that the series itself portrays this as much as the book does, because come on, series-Villanelle is funny and relatable and we love her. And one of the reasons why we love her is: we haven’t seen the worst of her yet. I think if they’d actually showed Villanelle killing Nadia in Russia, it would have affected my view of her character. Now though, she’s stabbed and wounded and probably either very pissed off or very impressed. Based on her character and her “childishness”, my money’s on the first option, but I still doubt that the show will ever take Villanelle to the depth of her violence and actually show it to us. Part of me wishes they would, though. I’d love to see her in proper action. I hope this answers your question :)

summary: I realised this afternoon I need to write a Sheriarty/Killing Eve crossover like I need air, and I hate myself so much for it....
body:
I realised this afternoon I need to write a Sheriarty/Killing Eve crossover like I need air, and I hate myself so much for it. TOO MUCH FANFIC.

But it has to happen. Jim and Villanelle in the same ‘verse is too tempting to resist.

Villanelle: I wank over you a lot.

Me: SNOG SNOG SNOG YOU ARE LITERALLY THERE TELLING EACH OTHER YOU WANT TO PLEASE JUST FUCKING SNOG AND THEN HAVE THE HOTTEST SEX.
